data.description: An introduction to the issues surrounding housing precarity and being unhoused in the U.S. Explore the role of housing markets, social policies, demography, history, social provision, and attitudes impacting access to this fundamental good. Discuss social policies and service needs relevant to unhoused persons. Classroom and community-based learning experiences.
data.title: HOUSING PRECARITY AND SOCIAL POLICY

data.description: Provides an awareness of problems and concepts of the policy process in the U.S. Explores the political, economic, and institutional frameworks which structure public social welfare choices.
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO SOCIAL POLICY
